content.title: Amoeba, the cult record shop

introduction.small: This Hollywood Boulevard store, which has two other branches in Berkeley and San Francisco, is an essential destination for music lovers.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Amoeba, the cult record shop

paragraphs.text:
When the owners of the legendary Amoeba store announced that it was moving in 2020, aficionados of the world's largest record shop broke out in a cold sweat. Luckily, their fears were soon laid to rest. Not only is its new address on the corner of Hollywood Boulevard and Argyle Avenue, next to the Fonda Theatre and the Hollywood Walk of Fame, just a couple of blocks from the old one, but Amoeba is now bigger and better than ever, occupying 2,000 sqm on the ground floor of the huge El Centro complex.

Set aside at least an afternoon to rummage through the store in search of that rare musical gem. Wherever you look, racks are crammed with hundreds of thousands of CDs, records, and cassettes, both new and second-hand and catering to tastes from niche to mainstream. Reckon on spending a few more hours at Amoeba if you want to roam the mezzanine level, where you will find countless DVDs, Blu-Ray disks, books, magazines, vintage posters and even an array of rock T-shirts… For dreamers and music lovers, this is quite simply paradise.

Amoeba Music
6200 Hollywood Boulevard
Los Angeles, CA 90028

+1 323 245 6400

https://www.amoeba.com

content.title: Angels Flight, a vintage-style funicular

introduction.small: Just 91 m in length, this National History Landmark is the world's shortest railway.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Angels Flight, a vintage-style funicular

paragraphs.text:
It was built by Col. James Ward Eddy, a friend of President Abraham Lincoln, and began operating in 1901. The funicular provided residents of Bunker Hill, which until the 1940s was populated with impressive Victorian mansions, with a convenient way to get to the shops in the city centre. In the 2000s, by which time the fancy villas had long been replaced by a huge administrative centre, this historic icon of old Los Angeles gradually fell into disuse.

Luckily, in the City of Angels, cinema gives everything a second lease of life. In 2016, Damien Chazelle's musical comedy La La Land revived interest in the funicular when a romantic scene was shot in one of its black and orange cars. Following the film's worldwide success, the city council had the bright idea of restoring Angels Flight.

The funicular is open every day from 6:45 am to 10 pm (a ticket costs 1 USD) and attracts crowds of tourists wanting to follow in the footsteps of Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone and take a photo in front of the marble and glass towers of Bunker Hill.

Angels Flight
350 South Grand Avenue
Los Angeles, CA 90071

+1 213 626 1901

https://www.angelsflight.org

content.title: The Bradbury Building, a piece of Los Angeles history

introduction.small: If you are a fan of the silver screen, then the Bradbury Building, one of the most famous buildings in Los Angeles, belongs on your itinerary.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Bradbury Building, a piece of Los Angeles history

paragraphs.text:
From the outside, with its four floors and terracotta façade, the Bradbury Building at Broadway and 3rd Street looks like the buildings in lots of big American cities. You need to step inside the monumental door to appreciate the splendour of this landmark, which was commissioned in 1893 by Lewis L. Bradbury (1823-1892). The millionaire businessman intended to bring his various enterprises together under its roof but did not live to see the building completed.

The story goes that architect George Wyman was initially unsure about taking the commission but accepted it after making contact with the spirit of his dead brother during a seance. His brother is said to have told him: “Take the Bradbury Building and you will be successful!”

You sense this other-worldly aspect of the building's history as soon as you enter the awe-inspiring atrium, with its huge glass roof that floods the space with light. Wherever you look, there are intertwining, spectacular cast-iron staircases, period hydraulic lifts and jet-black iron railings. The upper floors are occupied by commercial offices, so only the atrium and lower floors are accessible to visitors. But do not worry, a short stroll around this National History Landmark is all it takes to literally travel back in time. There is a reason why feature-length classics such as Blade Runner (1982) and The Artist (2011) were filmed here. The Bradbury Building is a star in its own right!

Bradbury Building
304 South Broadway
Los Angeles, CA 90013

+1 213 626 1893

https://www.laconservancy.org/locations/bradbury-building

content.title: Tacos 1986, bringing Tijuana to Los Angeles

introduction.small: The whole of Los Angeles has fallen for the delicious tacos at Tacos 1986, in the city centre.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Tacos 1986, bringing Tijuana to Los Angeles

paragraphs.text:
It is the kind of success story that foodies love. The phenomenon that is Tacos 1986 began with a simple food truck, like so many others you find in the streets around Hollywood. Through his tacos, the chef of this travelling kitchen, Jorge “El Joy” Alvarez-Tostado, wanted to share the flavours of his childhood in Tijuana, Mexico, combined with the inspirations he found in Los Angeles. Within a few short months, he had made a name for himself on the gastronomic scene. Now, all of Los Angeles frequents his bricks and mortar, taqueria-style restaurant in the centre of town, from neighbourhood kids to top celebrities.

The Tacos 1986 menu is based on four recipes from Joy's childhood. Why not try the sweet flavours of Abodaba, pork shoulder marinated and cooked on a vertical rotisserie, then carefully carved and placed in a corn tortilla shell. Spicy sauce, guacamole, onions, and fresh coriander provide the finishing touch. If you are lucky, you might also get the chance to enjoy one of these tacos from the original food truck, which still makes its way through the city streets, bringing the flavours of Tijuana to Los Angeles.

Tacos 1986
Downtown Los Angeles
609 South Spring Street
Los Angeles, CA 90024

+1 213 988 7202

https://www.tacos1986.com

Menu: from 3.25 USD per taco

content.title: Hollywood Forever Cemetery, cemetery of the stars

introduction.small: For visitors who want to pay tribute to a favourite star no longer with us, or go to an open-air screening with a difference, the Hollywood Forever Cemetery is just a short walk from Paramount Studios.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Hollywood Forever Cemetery, cemetery of the stars

paragraphs.text:
Here, in the movie capital of the world, it was only right that the final resting place for Hollywood luminaries should be an extraordinary one. The Hollywood Forever Cemetery was founded in 1899 and is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. The cemetery is a must-see for all film fanatics. Pick up a paper map or consult the digital version on your smartphone and wind your way through its peaceful rows. Here, you will find the graves of Judy Garland, Cecil B. DeMille, Rudolph Valentino and a little further on, those of Douglas Fairbanks, Tyrone Power and Mickey Rooney. As you reach the lake, your eyes will be drawn to the impressive grave of Ramones guitarist, Johnny Ramone. The famous musician is immortalised by a statue atop the monument, of him playing his guitar in full rock mode.

And there are other surprises in store for cemetery visitors. Every Saturday evening from June to September, open-air screenings are held on its leafy central esplanade. On movie nights, once you have purchased your ticket from Cinespia Cemetery Screenings, simply come with a blanket, pillow, or low chair, and take in a Hollywood classic. Be sure to arrive early to take advantage of the DJ, who keeps the cheering crowd entertained with music until the last ray of sun disappears behind the gravestones. Thrill-seekers may be interested to know that there is a special screening at Halloween… Goosebumps are guaranteed!

Hollywood Forever Cemetery
6000 Santa Monica Boulevard
Los Angeles, CA 90038

+1 323 469 1181

https://hollywoodforever.com
https://cinespia.org/how-to/cemetery/

content.title: Agnes Restaurant & Cheesery, a helping of Midwestern nostalgia

introduction.small: Pasadena's Agnes restaurant offers traditional gastronomy from the Midwest, the geographical centre of the United States.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Agnes Restaurant & Cheesery, a helping of Midwestern nostalgia

paragraphs.text:
Do not be surprised if you come across increasing numbers of Los Angeles restaurants dedicated to American Midwestern culture. Many Angelenos are adopted Californians who arrived there from states like Nebraska, Minnesota, Kansas, and Wisconsin - in other words, the states that make up the country's geographical centre.

They include Thomas Kalb, originally from Iowa, who left his home state to put his culinary talents to use on the West Coast. Now at Agnes, the restaurant named after his maternal grandmother, he is introducing food lovers in Pasadena and the surrounding area to all the flavours of his childhood. The restaurant is housed in the former horse stable of the district fire department, built in 1922. Behind its massive, original doors, the chef puts a modern twist on comforting family food. Try the Cornbread Eclair - typical Midwestern cornbread, reworked into an éclair with chicken liver mousse, topped with cherries - or Little Radiators, home-made pasta with tomato sauce, Pecorino and Burrata, a reference to the Italian influences in Midwestern cooking. And since the sun is always shining in Los Angeles, why not savour all these delicious recipes on the splendid leafy patio?

Agnes Restaurant & Cheesery
40 West Green Street
Pasadena, CA 91105

+1 626 389 3839

https://www.agnesla.com

Menu: around 22 USD

content.title: Experience truly unique cuisine at the Girl & The Goat

introduction.small: Stephanie Izard, the executive chef and co-owner at Girl & The Goat, is undoubtedly one of America's most creative new generation chefs.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Experience truly unique cuisine at the Girl & The Goat

paragraphs.text:
Having first found fame through a television programme, Stephanie Izard spent ten years taking her Girl & The Goat restaurant in Chicago to gastronomic heights. Now, this young woman is making her mark in Los Angeles, and foodies can get a taste of the flavour-specialist's unique recipes in the heart of the Arts District. In her kitchen, this one-of-a-kind chef creates remarkable dishes, combining sweet, salty, sour, and spicy elements to produce a delightful taste explosion.

At her new restaurant, Stephanie Izard offers an American Midwest-West Coast fusion, using local inspirations and regional produce. The daring chef sets herself apart with constant experimentation: take her sticky glazed pork shank served with shiitake mushrooms, strawberries, hoisin mayo, mustard and naan; pan-fried opah accompanied by a green sauce and almonds for seafood lovers; or whole grilled broccoli with smoked blue cheese and crunchy spices. Whatever you choose, the experience will leave you speechless!

Girl & The Goat
555-3 Mateo Street
Los Angeles, CA 90013

+1 213 799 4628

https://girlandthegoat.com/los-angeles

Menu: around 30 USD

content.title: Downtown LA Proper Hotel, the beating heart of Los Angeles

introduction.small: Behind a Neo-Renaissance façade typical of old Los Angeles, a Charlie's Angels-style trio of women - a designer and two chefs - have pooled their talents to create the Downtown LA Proper Hotel.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Downtown LA Proper Hotel, the beating heart of Los Angeles

paragraphs.text:
This grand building dates back to 1926 and has in turn been a private club and a headquarters of the YWCA feminist organisation. It is perfectly positioned, right in the heart of old Los Angeles and moments from the city's most lively neighbourhoods. The interior design of the hotel is the work of designer Kelly Wearstle. Her inimitable style is evident in the 148 rooms and suites, where periods and influences are mixed and matched in a harmonious blend of colours, textures, and materials (metal, stone, and wood). The Downtown LA Proper Hotel team are fans of wellness and relaxation and offer personalized services and an array of amenities to ensure you have a varied stay. They include a fully equipped gym which is open 24 hours a day, high-quality tailored fitness programming, a heated rooftop pool and a solarium.

The menu designed by the pairing of Suzanne Goin and James Beard Foundation award-winner Caroline Styne makes this an essential destination for all foodies. Depending on your mood, you can choose between the Caldo Verde restaurant and its Mediterranean-inspired dishes, and the Cara Cara, located on the terrace, where focaccia, tacos and burgers are all prepared with ingredients from the market. As a bonus, take in the 360° view of Los Angeles, as you soak up the sweet Californian sunshine.

Downtown LA Proper Hotel
1100 South Broadway
Los Angeles, CA 90015

Tel : +1 800 806 1947

https://www.properhotel.com/downtown-la/

Chambre : à partir de 350 USD

content.title: Grand Central Market, an icon of downtown LA

introduction.small: This indoor market with its unique ambiance is the perfect destination for light refreshments or a delicious pit stop.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Grand Central Market, an icon of downtown LA

paragraphs.text:
Located opposite “Angels Flight”, the archway of the funicular railway linking the city's Historic Core to the Bunker Hill district, Grand Central Market is a real institution in Los Angeles. The GCM, as the Angelenos refer to it, occupies the entire ground floor of the Homer Laughlin Building, which was built in 1917. The market first made a name for itself as a food hall and for over half a century, it was where residents came to do their grocery shopping. It was only in the 1980s that the Grand Central Market became the trendy food court it is today, under the leadership of businessman Ira Yellin - to whom Los Angeles owes the restoration of typical buildings like the Bradbury Building, the Million Dollar Theatre and Union Station. The market is open every day from 8 am until 9 pm.

As soon as you step through one of the doors from Broadway, you are immersed in a cosmopolitan melting pot of office workers grabbing lunch, housewives shopping for groceries, and tourists seeking culinary adventures. Spanning some 3,000 sqm, this huge market has numerous stalls filled with local products - fruit, vegetables, shellfish, fish, meats, and spices -, as well as food stalls offering a dizzying array of specialities from the four corners of the globe. A guaranteed feast for the eyes and taste buds, for young and old.

Grand Central Market
317 South Broadway
Los Angeles, CA 90013

+1 213 359 6007

https://www.grandcentralmarket.com

content.title: Beautiful motor cars at the Petersen Automotive Museum

introduction.small: In a city where the car is king, this museum presents more than a century and a half of automotive history.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Beautiful motor cars at the Petersen Automotive Museum

paragraphs.text:
The museum was founded in 1994 and redesigned in 2015. Its owner, the press magnate Robert E. Petersen commissioned the architectural firm KPF to wrap the 1960s building in an incredible futuristic structure. Visitors to the Petersen Automotive Museum will be instantly impressed by the new façade, made from 100 tonnes of wavy steel ribbons.

Spanning 10,000 sqm, the PAM is America's top car museum. More than 100 vehicles are displayed over four floors and a hundred or so others are stored in a vault on the basement level and shown during temporary exhibitions.

Given the proximity of the Hollywood studios, you will not be surprised to come across some of the most famous models from TV and cinema, including the DeLorean from Back to the Future and the Ford Thunderbird from Thelma et Louise. Several collections retrace the history of the automotive industry, from the Tricycle Benz (1885), regarded as the world's first ever motor car, to the Ferrari 250 GTO, one of the most expensive cars ever made. As you pass through the galleries, admire the impressive racing cars, period motorcycles, and concept cars, not to mention numerous objects, photos, videos, and documents from Robert E. Petersen's private collection.

This temple dedicated to the motor car caters for children too. Little ones will be thrilled to encounter the life-size stars of Pixar Studios' Cars trilogy, whilst teenagers can test their skills in the driving simulator or have fun learning about the mysteries of mechanics. An amazing family day out!

Petersen Automotive Museum
6060 Wilshire Boulevard
Los Angeles, CA 90036

+1 323 964 6331

https://www.petersen.org

content.title: The Butcher's Daughter, a healthy taste of the Californian lifestyle

introduction.small: At the Butchers Daughter, with its plants and macramé décor, fruits and vegetables are the stars. Stop here to top up on vitamins!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Butcher's Daughter, a healthy taste of the Californian lifestyle

paragraphs.text:
Located on Abbot Kinney Boulevard, a hipster paradise in the Venice neighbourhood, this one café embodies all the health trends taking California by storm. Despite the name, you will not find any meat products at The Butcher's Daughter. Here, fruit and vegetables are treated the same way a butcher works with meat: everything is chopped, sliced, and cut up to create vegetarian dishes. The menu changes regularly and celebrates seasonal, organic ingredients.

Angelenos sit at wooden tables beneath macramé decorations and hanging plants, drinking a freshly squeezed juice such as the Goddess of Green (kale, cucumber, green apple, fennel, pineapple, thyme, and spirulina) and filling up on vitamins, or munching on pancakes, a mixed salad, a sandwich, or avocado on toast. The Butcher's Daughter does not take reservations, and tables are in demand for weekend brunch. So, stop by in the week to take advantage of the peace and greenery, whether inside the restaurant or outside on the delightful terrace.

The Butcher's Daughter
1205 Abbot Kinney Boulevard
Venice
Los Angeles, CA 90291

+1 310 981 3004

https://www.thebutchersdaughter.com

Menu: from 9 USD per juice

content.title: The Wayfarer, a new way to experience LA

introduction.small: Located a few hundred metres from the Staples Center and Angels Flight, The Wayfarer Downtown LA is all about art and community spirit.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Wayfarer, a new way to experience LA

paragraphs.text:
The Wayfarer Hotel in the heart of Downtown offers travellers in search of new experiences an original way to learn about the city's diverse culture. Works by renowned artists are scattered throughout the hotel from the games rooms to the 156 private and dormitory-style bedrooms, bringing multiple stories and world views to life. In the foyer is an impressive library corner, containing over 600 books about Los Angeles or written by natives of the so-called City of Angels, as well as an installation by artist David Lovejoy, featuring books suspended in the air.

After a day exploring the neighbourhood's numerous museums and boutiques, why not relax by the pool on the roof terrace. Take advantage of the magnificent view of Los Angeles, as one of the Rooftop bar mixologists expertly conjures up your cocktail. When the sun sets, make your way to Lilly Rose, the cabaret tucked away in the hotel's basement. This timeless venue where strange meets beautiful - expect kitsch chandeliers, vintage furniture and stools taken from an old fairground ride - regularly hosts magic shows, live music sets and burlesque acts. The Wayfarer Downtown LA is always full of surprises!

The Wayfarer Downtown LA
813 South Flower Street
Los Angeles, CA 90017

+1 213 285 4400

https://www.wayfarerdtla.com

Rooms: from 167 USD

content.title: Hippo, true street corner restaurant

introduction.small: In the Highland Park neighbourhood, Hippo and its chef Matt Molina praise simple and quality cuisine, meant to be shared on large family tables.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Hippo, true street corner restaurant

paragraphs.text:
In Los Angeles, the Highland Park neighbourhood is now a posh and crowded hangout, replete with gastro-pub restaurants and other fine dining establishments. It is therefore no exaggeration saying that Hippo sticks out in this trendy landscape. When chef Matt Molina launched it, the goal was to offer a street corner-type of restaurant with simple and family food. Since then, the place is constantly crowded.

The interiors are huge, with wood framework overhanging while the walls are covered with large flowers and fern, stylised in yellow, orange and red tones. Comfortably set on a long bottle green bench seat, take your pick among the various seasonal dishes on the menu. Feel free to try innovative blends of flavours, like the burrata served with rye berries, nectarines, green onions and mint, green lasagne with farm-grown-pork stew, roast chicken with harissa paste and watercress, or even barbecued quails wrapped in pancetta ham, with honey and sage. A breath of fresh air, far from the neighbourhood's common culinary practices.

Hippo
5916 1/2 North Figueroa Street
Los Angeles, CA 90042

+1 323 545 3536

https://www.hipporestaurant.com

Menu: around 35 USD

content.title: NoMad, from New York to Los Angeles

introduction.small: It already won New Yorkers over. Now, NoMad spreads to the City of Angels, where it gives Hollywood glamour a new lease on life.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: NoMad, from New York to Los Angeles

paragraphs.text:
In Downtown Los Angeles, NoMad has taken up residence in a historic building, the Giannini Place, a former bank built in 1920 for the Bank of Italy. Doric columns by the entrance and original marble floors make up NoMad's neoclassical decoration. Just like in New York, Frenchman Thierry Garcia designed the hotel. In the rooms, styles and period collide, and pieces of furniture are assembled like works of art for a striking and surprising end result. Even if you do not stay at the hotel, take the time to have dinner at the hotel's restaurant, chefs Daniel Humm and Will Guidara's first establishment outside of New York. On the rooftop, an outdoor pool and a cocktail bar await, perfect settings to sip on a Gin Tonic – in moderation, obviously – while looking over all of Los Angeles.

Hôtel NoMad
649 S Olive St
Los Angeles, CA 90014

+1 213 358 0000

www.thenomadhotel.com/los-angeles

Rooms: from 259 USD

content.title: Botanica: one spot, three projects

introduction.small: At once a restaurant, a market and a magazine, Botanica invites you to share healthy, colourful and creative cuisine.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Botanica: one spot, three projects

paragraphs.text:
Botanica has taken up residence on the premises of a former liquor shop in the neighbourhood of Silver Lake. The XXL-size "Liquor" sign survived the change of owners and gives the place an industrial feel. Founders Heather Sperling and Emily Fiffer are food journalists who wanted to make it into something altogether different. The Botanica concept spurred three projects: a restaurant, a market and an online food magazine. On the website, you will find a lot of recipes, some of which being prepared at the restaurant, and easily reproduced at home using products from the Silver Lake market. If local and seasonal produce are the menu's highlights, this is no vegetarian restaurant, as you will find several meat or fish-based dishes. Try the chicken with herbs and rice salad with ginger, shallots and hot pepper oil for instance! The two creators of the place insist on the fact that there actually is no rule to follow. Good vibes and creativity are the only operative words here!

Botanica
1620 Silver Lake Blvd
Los Angeles, CA 90026

+1 323 522 6106

botanicarestaurant.com

Menu: around 25 USD

content.title: Hasiba, hummus paradise

introduction.small: With Hasiba, Israel, Morocco and most of the Middle East set up home in the Californian megalopolis.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Hasiba, hummus paradise

paragraphs.text:
A passion project for two lovers of Middle Eastern cuisine, Hasiba is a hummusiya, a typically Israeli restaurant where they serve hummus. The neighbourhood lunchroom serves kosher dishes in a casual atmosphere. The menu is simple: three selections of hummus and pita bread and two shakshuka ones (traditional Israeli tomato and egg-based dish). According to your taste, pair them with local salad, homemade pickles, aioli fries or a cauliflower gratin. Hummus is traditionally handmade. Speciality hummuses are also worth a try, including one with mushrooms and chermoula (a North African sauce usually served with fish, vegetables or poultry). At Hasiba, you will also find shakshuka variations, made with potatoes, chili and jalapeños peppers. These Israeli dishes will be best paired with Turkish coffee or fresh mint green tea, and the meal will end with a grand finale of fried pita bites in honey and sugar.

Hasiba
8532 Pico Boulevard
Los Angeles, CA 90035

+1 424 302 0225

https://www.hasibarestaurant.com

Menu: around 25 USD

content.title: The best street art in Los Angeles

introduction.small: In Los Angeles, even walls can become famous. Discover the city's best wall graffiti.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The best street art in Los Angeles

paragraphs.text:
Walls covered in graffiti are a dime a dozen in Los Angeles, spread all around town. You can have fun finding them out, starting with the best known: the "Colette Miller Wings", of giant size and in bold colours, are among the easiest to find in the city. And yet, you will have more than a hundred more to discover. Rest assured, they can be seen in almost every neighbourhood. Melrose Avenue is a particular hotspot, especially known for its giant "Pink Wall". Near the beach, in the Venice and Santa Monica street art strongholds, you will find graffiti covering many shop fronts. As for Silver Lake, staircases have become their main canvas. The collection constantly grows, and you may well come across brand new XXL graffiti during your stay!

Pink Wall on Melrose Avenue

Los Angeles, CA 90046

Micheltorena stairs in Silver Lake

Los Angeles, CA 90026

content.title: Travel back in time at Petit Ermitage

introduction.small: Nestled in West Hollywood, this eccentric boutique hotel will make your stay in Los Angeles unforgettable.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Travel back in time at Petit Ermitage

paragraphs.text:
Mystical, bohemian, charming… the Petit Ermitage hotel is truly surprising and looks unlike anything else in Los Angeles. In the lobby, alligators look out for customers coming and going. In the hotel corridors and in the bedrooms, walls are adorned with works of art by Miro, de Kooning and Dali. New York artist Greg Haberny even made suite 406 his Los Angeles home away from home. As you arrive, ask for rooftop access, as it's really where it all happens. There, you will find a salt water pool, heated and reserved to adults from noon until daybreak. A small cabana, away from prying eyes, will also give you unobstructed views over the whole city. As for lunch or dinner, you may want to favour the garden, in which hummingbirds and butterflies will join you for your meal.

Petit Ermitage
8822 Cynthia St
West Hollywood, CA 90069

+1 310 854 1114

www.petitermitage.com

Rooms: from 280 USD

content.title: The Line, for dizzyingly high nights

introduction.small: Picture yourself waking up, the urban jungle at your feet, as if on top of the world. It is not a dream, but a morning reality at The Line.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Line, for dizzyingly high nights

paragraphs.text:
With its large picture windows and a view over Los Angeles, you'd better not be afraid of heights to stay at The Line. The landscape is part of every room's attraction, just like the minibars. Even the decoration, raw and industrial-looking, seems to have been thought out to sublimate what lies behind the windows. From your bed, you can gaze at the Hollywood hills, where locals and tourists alike enjoy going for a run, as well as Griffith Observatory. Finally, on the glasshouse-looking rooftop, you will find the hotel's restaurant, Commissary, which offers excellent all-you-can-eat brunches on weekends. Koreatown, where the hotel stands, is only a ten-minute drive away from Hollywood. And yet, you will feel like leaving Los Angeles altogether when staying at The Line, as the two districts are nothing alike. Much trendier than its neighbour, Koreatown will assuredly be a trip in itself.

The Line
3515 Wilshire Blvd
Los Angeles, CA 90010

+1 213 381 7411

www.thelinehotel.com

Rooms: from 225 USD

content.title: Mama Shelter, fun and refined

introduction.small: With nine hotels across the world, Mama Shelter has become a reference for offbeat evenings.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Mama Shelter, fun and refined

paragraphs.text:
Only a few steps away from the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Mama Shelter is the perfect location to be immersed in the quirky atmosphere of the starry neighbourhood. Over six floors and 70 bedrooms, the decoration is joyful and refined, including candy-pink walls, patterned tiles, marbled bathrooms and multicoloured chairs. It is the creation of Thierry Gaugain, the Frenchman behind every Mama Shelter project. In the bedrooms, enjoy a computer linked to a wide screen to set up photo viewing sessions and keep an original memory of your stay. Very popular for its incredible rooftops, the hotel offers 360° views of Los Angeles, from the mythical Hollywood sign to Downtown's business centre. You may have lunch and dinner there, but most importantly take in the incredible Californian sunset. Saturday and Sunday brunches await, best enjoyed with family and friends.

Mama Shelter
6500 Selma Ave
Los Angeles, CA 90028

+1 323 785 6600

www.mamashelter.com/en/los-angeles

Rooms: from 140 USD

content.title: Otoño harks back to Los Angeles' Spanish past

introduction.small: Even though the name designates Autumn, Otoño brings Iberian warmth back to Los Angeles.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Otoño harks back to Los Angeles' Spanish past

paragraphs.text:
It is in Highland Park's rapidly changing neighbourhood, northeast of the city, that you will find Otoño. In the kitchen, chef Teresa Montaño draws her inspirations from her native Mexico, from the State of California where she grew up, and also from her travels, including a two-month tour of Europe with mandatory stopovers in Valencia and Barcelona. For starters, whet your appetite with an assortment of tapas: pan con tomate, Iberian ham, grilled calamari and ham croquetes will be perfect choices to start the meal on a high note. Dive into a great Spanish classic for main: the paella. If you are already familiar with this key dish that long ago extended beyond Iberian borders, you may want to try the “Setas” version, with mushrooms and black truffle. For dessert, what could be best than a crema catalana with lemon and cinnamon?

Otoño
5715 N Figueroa St
Los Angeles, CA 90042

+1 323 474 6624

www.otonorestaurant.com

Menu: from 19 USD

content.title: Bavel: sumptuous blend of flavours

introduction.small: Food served at the Bavel restaurant offers a tasteful blend of Italian and Middle Eastern worlds.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Bavel: sumptuous blend of flavours

paragraphs.text:
Located in L.A.'s industrial Arts District, Bavel first opened as an Italian restaurant, but as time passed, various eastern influences left their imprint on the menu. Composed of hot and cold dishes, spicy deli meat from the Middle East, creamy hummus served on pita bread baked in a wood oven as well as various flat breads, it also offers delicious cocktails. Get ready for surprising desserts, like fried peaches served with an almond cake and farmhouse-milk ice cream, topped with Baharat spices.
The hanging garden made of a compendium of indoor plants hover above the dining room. When the lights are turned on at night, the vegetal rectangle turns into a shimmering chandelier. On the walls, the rustic look of the brick stones has been softened with the use of off-white colours, whilst the floor displays blue and yellow tile patterns. This wonderful mix is enhanced by candles, wicker chairs, marble tabletops and bar seats. A soft breeze blows on the heart of Los Angeles, straight from the East!

Bavel
500 Mateo Street
Los Angeles, CA 90013

+1 213 232 4966

https://baveldtla.com

content.title: Texan breakfast at HomeState

introduction.small: Truly iconic in Texas, the morning taco with scrambled eggs, bacon and red beans is now also an L.A. hallmark.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Texan breakfast at HomeState

paragraphs.text:
Forget about ground beef and tomato sauce of your classic Mexican taco: at HomeState, you will have its breakfast counterpart! Taking its inspiration from the morning snack cooked by Mexican-American moms and grandmas in Texas, this speciality is best served for brunch, a successful trend now in Los Angeles. HomeState already owns a restaurant on Hollywood Boulevard that is always packed. It is now possible to try these “breakfast tacos” near Highland Park, comfortably taking the sun in, seated in the 10-sqm patio. On the menu, the Trinity offers eggs, bacon, potatoes and cheddar in a wheat or corn tortilla, true mix of tex-mex origins. The Guadalupe (eggs, cheddar and chorizo) will delight spicy food enthusiasts. And for a vegetarian alternative, pick the Comal, with eggs, red beans and deliciously nutty Monterey Jack. Angelinos have been warned: when it comes to the art of breakfast, Texans own the title!

content.title: Discover Los Angeles through the hard work of your calves

introduction.small: Avoid the tourist buses and choose a more environmentally friendly and sporty visit: the Los Angeles bike tour.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Discover Los Angeles through the hard work of your calves

paragraphs.text:
Visiting Los Angeles by bike or on foot, that is original to say the least in the city ideal to do everything by car. Since 2010, Bike and Hike LA offers a tour of the highlights of the megalopolis, with a guide to tell you the history of each place, so well that the city of angels will no longer hold any secrets for you. Several routes are offered, such as the Hollywood Bike or Movie Star Home Tour. The most interesting, however, is the L.A. in A Day Tour. Starting from the famous Route 66, your bike will lead you to Beverly Hills and Bel Air to admire homes of the stars, before ending your tour on the most beautiful beaches: Santa Monica, Venice and Marina Del Rey. What could be better? After all your effort, all you have to do is lie on the sand and enjoy the rest of a day filled with emotions.

content.title: Contemporary art is the star of MOCA

introduction.small: Contemporary art in all its forms is on view at the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Contemporary art is the star of MOCA

paragraphs.text:
The Museum of Contemporary Art (MOCA) was founded in 1979 by and for artists. Today, more than 7,000 works of art in all types of media – painting, photography, sculpture or drawing – make it one of the most important collections of contemporary art in the world. The particularity of MOCA is to have distributed this gigantic collection over three different entities.

Downtown, MOCA Grand Avenue with its red brick walls within huge glass buildings; just steps away, MOCA Geffen has a very industrial architecture, while in West Hollywood, MOCA Pacific Design Center is adorned with primary colours.

At each of these three addresses, you will discover works by internationally renowned artists such as Robert Mapplethorpe, Andy Warhol, Roy Lichtenstein, Helmut Newton, Joan Miró, Giacometti, Max Ernst and Man Ray. For your eyes only!

content.title: The Sportsmen's Lodge, home to Hollywood stars

introduction.small: At Studio City, the Sportsmen's Lodge was standing well before the city surrounding it today, and it has become the cocoon of many movie stars.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Sportsmen's Lodge, home to Hollywood stars

paragraphs.text:
Follow in the footsteps of Clark Gable, Katharine Hepburn and John Wayne... All of Hollywood's finest have stayed at the Sportsmen's Lodge at one point or another and that alone makes it a place not to be missed. Today, you can slip into the shoes of a movie star yourself! And the hotel staff will do everything they can to make you feel like one.

 

Opened in Studio City in the 1880s, even before the invention of cinema, the place has seen everything from cowboys on their conquest of the West to Hollywood stars in sequined dresses. The 190 rooms retain this timeless charm while today being furnished in a very modern way in contrasting white and orange tones to create a sober but warm atmosphere.

Relax by the huge pool: thought to be the largest in the San Fernando Valley, a good place to settle in and relax until dinnertime.

Perhaps you will enjoy a visit to Warner Bros or Disney studios – they are just a few minutes away.

content.title: Terranea Resort, as close as one can be to the ocean

introduction.small: Just 50 kilometres from Los Angeles, and yet a totally different universe where nature and well-being have pride of place.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Terranea Resort, as close as one can be to the ocean

paragraphs.text:
The Palos Verdes peninsula stretches out towards the Pacific Ocean here in Southern California. The Terranea Resort has chosen to settle on this spot, in the middle of wild nature that almost makes you forget that you are in a huge seaside complex.

Located about 50 kilometres from Downtown Los Angeles, this enclave on the edge of the cliffs takes you into a world entirely devoted to relaxation.

The hotel offers 360 rooms and suites, but also 20 bungalows, 50 casitas (small houses) and 32 villas for more privacy. Whatever your preference, each home is arranged in different styles: Iberian, rustic or contemporary. Everything has been imagined to ensure that the building fits in as well as possible with the decor. The hotel is also committed to environmental programmes.

Enjoy a relaxing moment at the spa or an athletic moment at the golf course before going to dinner at one of the eight restaurants in the complex. Then don't forget to admire the magnificent sunset!

content.title: The Freehand, a five-star youth hostel

introduction.small: Looking for a unique hotel in downtown Los Angeles? Look no further, we have found a Californian treasure: The Freehand.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Freehand, a five-star youth hostel

paragraphs.text:
Unrivalled room service, interiors designed by Roman & Williams, comfortable bedding… Be sure to enjoy the great amenities available whatever the length of your stay! Housed in The Exchange historic building, in the heart of vibrant Los Angeles, The Freehand is a one-of-a-kind hotel appreciated by visitors from all walks of life.

Book your stay in this atypical spot with some aspects of a hostel but in an urban chic setting! Indeed, you will find many shared rooms with bunk beds here, all decorated in Native American motifs with extravagant touches. In a different style, the Scandinavian banquettes, old-fashioned paintings, colourful furniture and lighting fixtures from another era give a delicious charm to the dining areas. A unique spot!

content.title: HiHo Cheeseburger, the flavours of simplicity

introduction.small: The only burger restaurant to serve exclusively Wagyu beef, the establishment honours the best meats in the world for your pleasure.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: HiHo Cheeseburger, the flavours of simplicity

paragraphs.text:
The tradition of the American hamburger truly deserves to be perpetuated. To uphold the best quality, it is essential to carefully choose the meat. Here, Wagyu beef is in the spotlight. With several breeds used, including the famed Kobe beef, Wagyu beef is known worldwide for its tenderness, delicate flavour and marbled texture. Low in saturated fats and rich in vitamins and antioxidants, the cows are raised in the greatest respect for nature, and the restaurant makes a point of honour to buy from a collective of agro-responsible ranchers.

As a result, you cannot but appreciate the high-quality simplicity of the dishes offered by the establishment. Homemade cheeseburgers in which the beef and cheese are accompanied with perfect basics such as lettuce leaves, ketchup, onion jam, homemade pickles and roasted mustard all marry delicately to melt in your mouth.

content.title: The Kinney Hotel, gateway to Venice Beach

introduction.small: The motto of the Kinney Hotel? “Our house is your house.” Discover a hotel bathed in the California sun.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Kinney Hotel, gateway to Venice Beach

paragraphs.text:
On the agenda for your stay: relaxation and entertainment! Everything you need for a memorable visit to Venice Beach is here: the heated pool, ping pong table, cruiser rentals right on the beach, a gym and a hot tub. At Kinney Hotel, you will have no time to get bored, and you can discover the area in a whole new light… a colourful one!

Indeed, the new rooms of the hotel are bright and painted with fresh and spring-like colours, enchanting your morning awakenings. The day will begin smoothly and, after a generous breakfast, you will be plunged in the heart of a city full of excitement as soon as you set foot outside. Venice Beach is waiting for you!

content.title: Cosy dinner at Doheny Room

introduction.small: Nestled between The Troubadour and Dan Tana's, two of Santa Monica Boulevard's key spots, the Doheny Room is the place to go.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Cosy dinner at Doheny Room

paragraphs.text:
Doheny Room opened in the heart of West Hollywood. This glamourous restaurant has rapidly been taken over by the L.A. smart set. The interior evokes the charm of old Los Angeles, with lush greenery, comfortable bench seats, cool overtones for the furniture and huge floor-to-ceiling picture windows that give onto the street.

As you walk in, you'll find a large room on two levels, designed by architecture icon David Rockwell. It is in this lounge bar that serves late into the night (the kitchen closes at 12:30 a.m.) that all of chic and trendy We-Ho (for West Hollywood) gathers to enjoy Kobe beef, spicy jalapeño and tuna cream cones or vegetarian sushi in an intimate atmosphere. The latest hot spot in town, it counts many celebrities as regulars, such as Keanu Reeves and Winona Ryder. Against a backdrop of indie and R'n'B music, this anti-club may be the perfect place to toast with your favourite actor.

content.title: Crossroads Kitchen: the veggie burger

introduction.small: In L.A., Crossroads Kitchen is the new hangout of the stars where you will find vegan food, Mediterranean style.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Crossroads Kitchen: the veggie burger

paragraphs.text:
There is no food of animal origin here, neither eggs nor milk nor cheese. And yet you will hear throughout the city that the cooking is so good that even T-bone steak aficionados leave with stomachs full and smiles on their faces.

What is the secret to the Crossroads Kitchen? Perhaps it's the chef, Tal Ronnen, a vegan specialist that all Hollywood adores (Oprah Winfrey and Ellen DeGeneres swear by him). Perhaps it's the all-natural, gluten-free ingredients or the Mediterranean inspiration.

You have to try the "impossible burger", specialty of the house, with lettuce, tomato, onion and house sauce on a toasted bun served with a few truffle-flavoured fries, or maybe venture beyond with eggplant caviar and marinated vegetables in bittersweet sauce. The soups are delicious as is the Meatballs Sub (classic American sandwich revisited with meat variations and almond ricotta). If you are dedicated vegan, come on in! But even a carnivore headed down Melrose Avenue could be tempted by the 'vegan way of life'.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Dream Hollywood, California Dream at your fingertips

How about indulging in a trip to Dream Hollywood, in one of the most exquisite cities in America? Indeed, this is no illusion: behind the wide windows of your room stand the famous Hollywood Hills. Each room is elegantly decorated, combining the sobriety of its colours with the finesse of carefully chosen furniture. The modern and bright lines of the suites inspire visitors who come to taste the California dream.

Free valet parking, Wi-Fi throughout the hotel, a gym designed by Gunnar Peterson with a wide range of equipment, snacks and meals served in your room at any time of the day or night, several restaurants and a rooftop pool... all of this and more is offered to all hotel guests. Feeling tempted? Just give this unique experience a go!

content.title: Pasea Hotel and Spa, a luxurious California treasure

introduction.small: Enjoy an immersive experience in Huntington Beach, one of the most beautiful coastal towns in America. Guided tour of an exceptional hotel.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Pasea Hotel and Spa, a luxurious California treasure

paragraphs.text:
A short walk from Huntington Beach Pier, in the bustling heart of California, the Pasea Hotel & Spa offers a comfortable and modern haven for its visitors. With 250 rooms and very spacious suites, the establishment has undeniable assets to seduce guests. Hardly have you opened your eyes, early in the morning, that the golden sand beach beckons to you. From the floor-to-ceiling windows of your room, you will relish the unobstructed ocean views.

In the evening, take a refreshing break at the Balinese-inspired spa – with a eucalyptus hammam and a saltwater bath – then stop by the Treehouse Bar on the rooftop to savour a cocktail at sunset, in moderation of course. That is, unless you prefer to hit the waves, your surfboard under your arm, and watch the night fall over the horizon.

content.title: Oriel, French elegance in Los Angeles

introduction.small: Oriel, a delightful wine bar on Alameda Street, is a hit in Los Angeles' Chinatown. Its French touch is popular with foodies!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Oriel, French elegance in Los Angeles

paragraphs.text:
Dustin Lancaster strikes again. After creating the famous Covell and Augustine bars, the restaurateur has set up shop near Chinatown. Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the area, Oriel showcases French cuisine and wines. You will enter a space that resembles an industrial loft with peach and purple tones, giving the place undeniable charm.

Under the green plants hanging from the ceiling, settle into your chair at a small round table, lit by the whiteness of the sun that pierces through the large picture windows. Opt for a Frisée aux lardons salad, snails with parsley, garlic and butter, or exquisite artichokes in rouille sauce. Then choose your wine by the glass from among the valuable selection offered by the chef: white, red, sparkling or rosé? At Oriel's, anything goes!

content.title: Palihouse, a Santa Monica-style Boutique Hotel

introduction.small: At the Palihouse Hotel, discover an inviting family home combined with Santa Monica's highly hipster trends.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Palihouse, a Santa Monica-style Boutique Hotel

paragraphs.text:
This hotel located in the residential area of Santa Monica, just three blocks from the beach, is today as sought-after as the famous Château Marmont. Less flashy than some options of the same sort, the Palihouse is in a 1927 building, a sublime example of Mediterranean Revival architecture. In this hotel, the founder of the very visible Paligroup pays homage to Los Angeles with a melting-pot decor, reflecting the cultural mix of the city.

Here modernist style cohabits with very 1950s lines, and vintage objects are side by side with modern trinkets, like a porcelain dog proudly on display in the lobby and salon. In the same room, you can have breakfast, brunch or just read your book, like in a real family home. You will find the same feeling in the rooms: “toile de Jouy” reappears as wallpaper by Abnormals Anonymous and design objects contrast with old telephones, still-life paintings or hunting trophies. An alien ship at home in the landscape of Los Angeles!

Palihouse

content.title: In the Santa Monica hills

introduction.small: Fifty miles from the bustle of Los Angeles, the Santa Monica Mountains rise proudly above the shores of the Pacific Ocean. Do you dare to venture there?

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: In the Santa Monica hills

paragraphs.text:
From the Hollywood Hills, they extend from east to west to Point Mugu in Ventura County, 64 kilometres of a mountain range that divides the City of Angels into two territories: to the north, the San Fernando Valley and, to the south, the Los Angeles Basin. The Santa Monica Mountains belong to the famous Transverse Ranges, framed by the Californian coastal chains, the Tehachapi Mountains and the Coachella Valley. On clear days, the sky illuminates the mossy greenery and leafy trees that cover the hills, and at nightfall, stars reflect in the black water of the ocean.

If you are looking for athletic activities, the Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area invites you to various excursions: hiking, biking, horseback riding, rock climbing and camping should delight your kids with their overflowing energy.

content.title: Waldorf Astoria Beverly Hills, a world class hotel

introduction.small: The opening of this leading vessel of the Waldorf Astoria group has caused a sensation when it opened in the poshest of L.A.'s neighbourhoods. It reinvents the concept of luxury.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Waldorf Astoria Beverly Hills, a world class hotel

paragraphs.text:
This highly modern 12-floor tower stands over 9 hectares and amid a luxurious garden environment. As you enter the dazzling lobby – in which you will also notice the traditional Waldorf Astoria clock – for the first time, you will get a feel of the sumptuous Art Deco design. Stretching your definition of gigantism and luxury, the style permeates the whole hotel, comprised of 170 rooms and suites. Stop by the rooftop and enjoy the biggest pool in all of the City of Angels with a view worthy of the best Hollywood films.
The palace's decoration has been left in the hands of Frenchman Pierre-Yves Rochon, the superstar of interior designers. But the French touch does not stop at the various frescoes and Lalique crystals used: among the three hotel restaurants, you shouldn't miss the Jean-Georges, named after chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten. His gastronomic establishment is based on a short-circuit concept from the producer directly to your plate, offering all that is best in French food, whilst not forgetting about Californian, Asian and South-American influences.

content.title: At The London, all of West Hollywood's charm

introduction.small: At a stone's throw from the centre of Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive shops, The London West Hollywood will seduce you with a beautiful rooftop swimming pool.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: At The London, all of West Hollywood's charm

paragraphs.text:
Whether in Hollywood for business or pleasure, the West Hollywood district fosters relaxation, especially if you're staying at The London. Regulars abound, which is a good sign of the lively nature of the place, where you should always expect something to happen. You'll soon feel at home as much in one of the 200 rooms – bearing contemporary design – as in the agreeable communal areas where you could actually spend hours of your time.
Look for these well-being breaks and reach for the sky: the rooftop, which is one of the most sought-after in the neighbourhood, offers a swimming pool and a restaurant, the Boxwood on the Roof, both with exceptional vistas onto the City of Angels. Food lovers could even give in to tempting sea salt ice creams by Scott Brothers Dairy, L.A.'s key ice-cream maker. You'll feel so good that the two lovely house bulldogs, Winston and Churchill, will adopt you in no time.

content.title: Johnny Rockets, the taste of America

introduction.small: Burgers of all kinds and Fifties décor, this national chain deserves some attention here, especially because it's on the famous Hollywood Boulevard.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Johnny Rockets, the taste of America

paragraphs.text:
Unknown outside the U.S., the Johnny Rockets restaurant chain is an inevitability in the country of Uncle Sam. The city of Los Angeles has no fewer than five addresses. Make a stop at the legendary Hollywood Boulevard location. You cannot miss this diner straight out of the 1950s with its Cadillac-like façade, chrome bar and burgundy leatherette stools. It's like being in an episode of the popular series Happy Days. Besides all the clichés of the genre, JR (not the one in Dallas!) is known for its huge burgers and litre-sized milkshakes. It's heaven for the hungry person.

content.title: Hollywood Historic Hotel, closer to the stars

introduction.small: Hollywood celebrities have patronised this hotel since it opened in 1927. Its charm is delightfully old-fashioned.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Hollywood Historic Hotel, closer to the stars

paragraphs.text:
With its red brick Georgian architecture, the former Hollywood Melrose Hotel, built in 1927 and a heritage-status building, is part of the mythic landscape of the 'City of Angels'. Completely restored to the original, the lobby and public areas sparkle with their beautiful mouldings, chandeliers and chairs covered in silk. The decor is more restrained in the rooms, and a little bit vintage. Comfort is optimal with extra-thick mattresses, flat-screen televisions, minibar and coffeemaker. The last two are always welcome as the hotel does not serve breakfast. The neighbourhood, although somewhat eccentric, is full of small cafes. What a good start before visiting the most famous movie studios, including the Paramount just steps away.

content.title: Hollywood Museum: unique in the world for its diversity

introduction.small: Original collections of costumes, posters, and personal effects celebrate the history of American cinema and its stars.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Hollywood Museum: unique in the world for its diversity

paragraphs.text:
A true archive of the silver screen, this museum tells the story of the seventh art chronologically, from silent films to modern movies. There are over 10,000 costumes, autographs, posters, and accessories recovered from major Hollywood productions.

Film buffs will love the behind-the-scenes material, especially the tributes to actors who have died tragically. Scattered throughout are gems like the Superman costume worn by Christopher Reeve, Sylvester Stallone's boxing gloves from Rocky, and Marilyn Monroe's dress in The Seven Year Itch.

The glamorous Marilyn is particularly well represented, with a masterful exhibition of unreleased recordings, clothes, photographs, and other official documents. In the room reserved for recent films, costumes for the French film The Artist are among those in the spotlight.

Hollywood Museum

content.title: Millennium Biltmore: extravagant excess

introduction.small: This mythic hotel has played host to eight Academy Awards ceremonies and courted royalty, presidents, and movie stars.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Millennium Biltmore: extravagant excess

paragraphs.text:
Memorable scenes from Beverly Hills Cop and The Sting were shot here, where the Venetian Gothic style that was fashionable in the 1930s is almost overwhelming.

With its coffered ceilings and Renaissance frescoes painted by an Italian artist whose work is also in the White House and the Vatican, this is a grandiose experience. Upstairs, the rooms and suites are rather classical, bathed in an atmosphere of luxury and pleasure.

Beds are sometimes adorned with lavish canopies. All rooms are spacious and comfortable with panoramic views of the city. Finally, do not leave this amazing place without going to the basement, where a sumptuous swimming pool is hidden. The rich mosaics and colonnades are greatly inspired by the palaces of ancient Rome.

Millennium Biltmore

content.title: Malibu: address of the stars

introduction.small: The golden sand of this small legendary coastal town casts a spell over everyone who goes there.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Malibu: address of the stars

paragraphs.text:
In this postcard-perfect landscape where the mountains meet the ocean, unspoilt nature is an authentic luxury, bringing together surfers, students, and celebrities, all of whom are very involved with their surroundings.

The most exclusive place is Carbon Beach, which boasts the highest real estate prices in the US. Long-time residents like Steven Spielberg, Mel Gibson, Jennifer Aniston, or Robert Redford have charming villas on stilts, which only add to the charm of the place.

In the 1990s, Carbon Beach was in the spotlight in the TV series Baywatch incidentally, actress Pamela Anderson lives next door. With its strong winds and the crashing waves of the Pacific, the beach cultivates a delicious atmosphere. Here, surfing is a religion and the Malibu Surfing Association, probably one of the oldest clubs in the world, reflects that idea. This might not be paradise, but it sure looks like it.

content.title: The Hollywood Sign: enter the legend!

introduction.small: You've seen it in Mulholland Drive and Nip/Tuck: everyone knows that when you're on holiday in California, you have to take a picture of the Hollywood Sign.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Hollywood Sign: enter the legend!

paragraphs.text:
A Los Angeles monument that is 14 metres high, the Hollywood sign is the biggest advertising billboard in the world. And, since 1973, the only one of its kind among cultural monuments the world over. When it was inaugurated on the grounds of the owner of Keystone Studios in 1923, it was "Hollywoodland".

After it had deteriorated over time because of lack of maintenance, the monument was saved by a private initiative instigated by Alice Cooper and Hugh Hefner. They stopped its demolition and replaced the letters with these made of durable Australian steel.

A ceremony of state, broadcast to 60 million viewers, unveiled the current version on the 75th anniversary of Hollywood, 14 November 1978. Under the surveillance of dozens of cameras and sensory detectors day and night, the Hollywood Sign is a standby in the Book of Records. Its revamp means it will be still be standing brightly for another 90 years.

Hollywood Sign
4730 Crystal Springs Drive
Los Angeles, CA 90027

https://hollywoodsign.org

content.title: Hotel Bel Air: an exclusive oasis

introduction.small: Luxury and serenity are the key strengths of this romantic getaway whose reputation for excellence is really not overrated.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Hotel Bel Air: an exclusive oasis

paragraphs.text:
This nugget of the Dorchester Group, which has strung together some gems in the international hotel business, combines impeccable service and management with true luxury. The 45 rooms and suites have had a recent revamp.

Some of them have large terraces with outdoor fireplaces. The Californian menu deserves your full attention. You will recognise Wolfgang Puck's French touch. Puck earned his chops at Maxim's, and the two-Michelin-starred L'Oustau de Baumanière before opening Spago on Sunset Boulevard.

True to his philosophy, the subtle and tasty cuisine features seasonal ingredients and local produce. And, pleasure awaits you at the Spa by La Prairie where seven poolside treatment rooms are the perfect place for its superlative anti-aging facial and body care techniques.
